Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "It feels strange. ......I used to think that the witch's side had such a huge advantage. But now that I'm on that side, I see that that's ridiculous. It's almost like that game where you stick knives in a barrel and try not to stab the mustache guy inside."
Umineko Project (UP): "It feels strange. .........I used to think that the witch side had such a huge advantage. But now that I'm on that side, I see that that's ridiculous. It's almost like that party game where you stick knives in a barrel."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "It feels strange. .........I used to think that the witch's side had such a huge advantage. But now that I'm on that side, I see that that's ridiculous. It's almost like that game where you stick knives in a barrel and try not to stab the mustache guy inside."
PC Japanese (JP): 「不思議な感覚だな。………かつては、魔女側に何て有利なゲームだろうと思ってた。だが、いざ魔女側になってみるととんでもないな。こいつはまるで樽にナイフを刺してく、ヒゲ男の樽ゲームみたいなもんだ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「不思議な感覚だな。………かつては、魔女側に何て有利なゲームだろうと思ってた。だが、いざ魔女側になってみるととんでもないな。こいつはまるで樽にナイフを刺してく、パーティゲームみたいなもんだ」
Russian (RU): "Странно. .........Раньше я считал, что у стороны ведьмы огромное преимущество. Но играя на этой стороне, я понял, что это чушь. Похоже на игру, где нужно кидать ножи в бочку так, чтобы не задеть усатого парня внутри."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "É uma sensação estranha. .........Eu costumava pensar que o lado da bruxa tinha uma vantagem avassaladora. Mas agora que estou desse lado, eu vejo que chega a ser ridículo. É quase como aquele jogo que você fica enfiando espadas no barril."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「很不可思議的感覺呢。………以前，我還以為這遊戲，是多麼地對魔女方有利。但是，一到自己站到魔女方的位置上一看，就根本不是這麼回事了。這傢伙，簡直就跟用匕首刺圓桶的派對遊戲差不多。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「很不可思议的感觉呢。………以前，我还以为这游戏，是多么地对魔女方有利。但是，一到自己站到魔女方的位置上一看，就根本不是这么回事了。这家伙，简直就跟用匕首刺圆桶的派对游戏差不多。」

Ma ora che sono di qua, capisco che è un pensiero ridicolo. {n}Sembra quasi quel gioco dove infili coltelli in un barile e cerchi di non colpire il tizio stipato all'interno."

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "Some people will find love, others won't. ...In that case, you can put those two groups on a scale. However, the scales for our trial have three plates, and two must lose for one to win. That seems horribly skewed..."
Umineko Project (UP): "Some people will find love, others won't. ......So I can understand placing those two groups on the two plates of a set of scales. But the scales for our trial have three plates, and two must lose for one to win... It seems horribly unbalanced..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Some people will find love, others won't. ......In that case, you can put those two groups on a scale. However, the scales for our trial have three plates, and two must lose for one to win. That seems horribly tilted..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「恋は得る者と得られない者がいる。……ならば、それらが天秤の両端に並ぶことは理解できます。しかし、私たちの試練の天秤は３つの皿が並び、１人の勝利のために２人が敗北するという、ひどく歪なものです…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「恋は得る者と得られない者がいる。……ならば、それらが天秤の両端に並ぶことは理解できます。しかし、私たちの試練の天秤は３つの皿が並び、１人の勝利のために２人が敗北するという、ひどく歪なものです…」
Russian (RU): "Одни обретут любовь, а другие нет. ......Поэтому можно положить две эти группы на весы. Но у весов нашего испытания три чаши, и для победы одной две другие должны проиграть. Ужасный наклон..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Algumas pessoas vão encontrar o amor, outras não. ......Eu entendo como se colocássemos dois grupos nos dois pratos da balança. Mas a balança da nossa prova possui três pratos, e dois devem perder para um vencer... Parece muito desbalanceado pra mim..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「愛情，有的人得到，有的人得不到。……那麼，它們並列於天平的兩端，我是能夠理解的。可是，我們考驗的天平卻是並列著 3 個秤盤，是個為 1 人的勝利致使 2 人敗北的，非常扭曲的東西…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「爱情，有的人得到，有的人得不到。……那么，它们并列于天平的两端，我是能够理解的。可是，我们考验的天平却是并列着 3 个秤盘，是个为 1 人的胜利致使 2 人败北的，非常扭曲的东西…」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Certe persone troveranno l'amore, altre no. ... In quel caso, puoi mettere quei due gruppi su una bilancia. Tuttavia, la bilancia per la nostra prova ha tre piatti, e due devono perdere perché uno vinca. Sembra orribilmente impari..."

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "Who knows? It might mean that successful love is worth two destroyed loves. ...You're too insecure, little sister. If you can't put your desire to answer to Battler's expectations before your uncertainty over what happens to the losers, you won't be able to win anything."
Umineko Project (UP): "Who knows? It might mean that successful love is worth two destroyed loves. ......Your words do not inspire confidence, little sister. PC Japanese (JP): 「さぁな。恋の価値とは、２組の恋の破綻と同じ価値があるとでも言うのかも知れぬな。……頼りないぞ、妹よ。敗者のことを考えるより、戦人の期待に応えたいという気持ちを優先できぬようでは、拾える勝利などないぞ。」

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela havia acabado de retornar de sua fervorosa batalha contra Battler, a qual lutou usando informações que obteve através das repetições requisitadas.

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Steam (ST): "First, in all cases, it was the victims themselves that constructed the closed rooms. Also, those closed rooms were perfectly preserved until Krauss's group broke them open. Also, I confirmed that during this period, all sorts of interference from the outside were impossible."
Umineko Project (UP): "First, in all cases, it was the victims themselves that constructed the locked rooms. Also, those locked rooms were perfectly preserved until Krauss's group broke them open. Also, I confirmed that during that period, all forms of interference from the outside were impossible."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "First, in all cases, it was the victims themselves that constructed the closed rooms. Also, those closed rooms were perfectly preserved until Krauss's group broke them open. Also, I confirmed that during that period, all sorts of interference from the outside were impossible."
PC Japanese (JP): 「まず、密室を構築したのは、いずれも犠牲者たち本人でした。そして、それを蔵臼たちが破るまでの間、その密室は完全に維持されていました。さらにその間、外部から如何なる方法でも干渉が出来ないことを確認しましたっ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「まず、密室を構築したのは、いずれも犠牲者たち本人でした。そして、それを蔵臼たちが破るまでの間、その密室は完全に維持されていました。さらにその間、外部から如何なる方法でも干渉が出来ないことを確認しましたっ」
Russian (RU): "Во‐первых, во всех случаях жертвы сами образовали закрытые комнаты. Кроме того, эти закрытые комнаты прекрасно сохранились до тех пор, пока группа Краусса не открыла их. Также я подтвердила, что в течение этого времени все вмешательства извне были невозможны."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Primeiro, em todos os casos, foram as próprias vítimas que construíram os quartos fechados. Além disso, aqueles quartos fechados estavam perfeitamente preservados até o grupo do Krauss interferir neles. E eu confirmei que durante esse período, todas as formas de interferência externas eram impossíveis."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「首先，構築密室的，全是犧牲者本人。其次，在藏臼等人打破密室前的那段時間裡，房間完全被維持在密室狀態。再者還確認了，在這段時間裡，從外面實行的任何方法全都無法進行干涉。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「首先，构筑密室的，全是牺牲者本人。其次，在藏臼等人打破密室前的那段时间里，房间完全被维持在密室状态。再者还确认了，在这段时间里，从外面实行的任何方法全都无法进行干涉。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Prima di tutto, in tutti i casi, sono state le vittime stesse ad aver costruito le camere chiuse. Inoltre, quelle stanze chiuse erano perfettamente conservate finché il gruppo di Krauss non vi ha fatto irruzione. E poi, ho accertato che durante quel lasso di tempo ogni sorta di interferenza dall'esterno era impossibile."

PC Japanese (JP): 「極めて合理的だよ。しかし、自分の運命を、乱数発生器に託すような無謀が出来るかと言われたら、答えはノーだけれどね。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「極めて合理的だよ。しかし、自分の運命を、乱数発生器に託すような無謀が出来るかと言われたら、答えはノーだけれどね」
Russian (RU): "Очень разумный. Но если ты спрашиваешь, хочу ли я безрассудно доверить свою судьбу генератору случайных чисел, мой ответ — нет."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "É extremamente razoável. Porém, se está perguntando se eu seria descuidado o suficiente para confiar meu destino a um gerador de números aleatórios, a resposta definitivamente seria um não."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「这样，是极其的合理哟。只不过，要是被问敢不敢做出“把自己的命运交给乱数发生器”的无谋之举，那回答就是 NO。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "È estremamente ragionevole. Tuttavia, se mi chiedessi se fossi abbastanza avventato da affidare il mio destino a un generatore di numeri casuali, la risposta è no."
